section.title: Tutorial 5: Exporting Data
section.para: Data can be exported from the result pages in various formats - excel (or open office) format, comma separated values, tab separated values, or for items with sequences, FASTA format (see below).

This tutorial will illustrate how to export data from a results table and from a bag. As an example, run the template 'Search for GO annotations for a particular gene' (Gene Ontology aspect) for the default value 'CG11348'. Currently, either the entire results table or specific columns can be exported. If nothing is selected, the entire data set will be exported. If you do not wish to export certain columns, then hide these columns using the 'hide' option in the column header.

To export a FASTA file of sequences you must create a query which returns the object details for each object you want to export (e.g. a set of Gene or Protein objects details, as opposed to simple attributes such as the gene symbol or identifier).

Some template queries will return results suitable for exporting FASTA files. Find the template 'Output genes from a particular organism in a format suitable for creating a FASTA database' (Genomics aspect).

The first column of the results table contains the object details of the genes, including a link to the FASTA sequences. To export the sequences, hide the columns which do not have any FASTA links and click on 'Export in FASTA format' at the bottom of the page. Only the sequences will be retrieved and downloaded.

Values stored in bags can also be exported. To export the contents of a bag, click on the bag name on the 'history' page. This will display the contents of the bag as a results page - with the export options available at the bottom of the page. Currently, it is not possible to export single items from the bag. Therefore, it is not necessary to tick any check-boxes in the bag as the whole bag will always be exported.
